insights.description: The party with the most representatives is PL, with 93 representatives.
The party with the least representatives is REDE and S.PART., each with only 1 representative.
The party with the highest percentage of representation is PL, with 18.13%.
The parties with the lowest percentage of representation are REDE and S.PART., each with only 0.19%.

The distribution of representatives is highly skewed, with a few parties holding a significant majority of the seats.  This indicates a potential concentration of political power within a smaller number of parties.
Several parties have a relatively small number of representatives (less than 10), suggesting a fragmented political landscape beyond the dominant parties.
The top three parties (PL, UNI√ÉO, and PT) control over 40% of the total representation, highlighting their significant influence in the Brazilian political system.
